title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a timeless dessert that combines a flaky homemade crust with a luscious, sweet pecan filling. Perfectly golden and beautifully textured, this pie is sure to become a cherished favorite for holidays or any special occasion.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in chilled butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix egg yolk with ice water and stir into flour mixture until dough forms a ball.
Wrap dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out chilled dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Mix in eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well blended.
Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for an additional 40 to 50 minutes, or until the pie is golden brown and the filling is set.
Allow pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling firm up.
tips: Use chilled butter and ice water for a flaky crust. Avoid overmixing the dough to keep it tender. Watch the pie closely during the last 10 minutes of baking to prevent the crust from burning. Let the pie cool fully to ensure the filling sets perfectly.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie is a delightful blend of buttery crust and sweet, nutty filling that melts in your mouth. Its golden top and rich aroma make it a standout dessert that brings warmth and nostalgia to any table.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Classic Southern dessert with authentic flavors
  • Flaky homemade crust paired with a rich pecan filling
  • Perfect for holidays, family gatherings, and special celebrations
  • Uses simple pantry staples you likely have on hand
  • A beautiful pie that impresses both in taste and presentation

structured_content.content: I first tried this recipe when a dear friend shared it with me, and it instantly became a family favorite. Every bite reminds me of cozy Southern kitchens and joyful holiday moments spent with loved ones.

• Main ingredient: Pecans add a rich, crunchy texture and deep nutty flavor essential to this pie. Use fresh halves for the best presentation and taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and adds warmth. Light corn syrup provides the perfect sticky, smooth filling texture.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter creates a flaky crust and adds richness; eggs bind the filling for a custard-like consistency.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pie plate, rolling pin, and oven are essential for perfect results.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in chilled butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill for at least 1 hour to relax gluten and firm the dough.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and fit into pie plate. Layer pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake at high heat for 10 minutes to set crust, then reduce temperature and bake until filling is golden and set, about 40-50 minutes.
Finishing Touches:
Cool completely on a wire rack to allow filling to firm. Serve slightly warm or at room temperature for best flavor and texture.

upload.context: Beautiful finished dish with vibrant colors and appetizing presentation

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Preheat oven to 450°F for the first 10 minutes to set the crust and filling.
  • Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling and burnt crust.
  • The filling is ready when it is golden brown and slightly jiggly but not liquid.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for up to 4 days; reheat gently.

structured_content.content: Sharing this pie with family always brings smiles and warm memories. It’s a dessert that invites conversation and comfort, making every gathering feel special and heartfelt.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a deeper flavor profile. Toast the pecans lightly before adding for extra crunch and aroma. A sprinkle of sea salt on top before baking can create a delightful sweet-salty contrast.

Serve warm with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a dollop of whipped cream. Pair with a cup of strong coffee or a glass of dessert wine for an indulgent treat. This pie shines at holiday dinners, potlucks, and festive celebrations.

For a gluten-free option, substitute the crust with a gluten-free pastry dough. Vegan versions can be made using plant-based butter and egg replacers, though texture will vary slightly. Try mixing in chocolate chips or dried fruit for a unique twist while keeping the classic spirit.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use chilled ingredients and minimal handling for a flaky crust.
  • Mix filling ingredients just until combined to avoid bubbles or cracks.
  • Start baking at high temperature to lock in moisture, then lower to finish baking evenly.
  • Brush crust edges with egg wash for a shiny, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With a little patience and love, this Southern Pecan Pie will reward you with rich flavors and a beautiful presentation that will impress everyone. Enjoy the process and the delicious results that bring a taste of Southern hospitality to your home.
